titleStmt.title: TEI P5 version 4.2.0 and Stylesheets version 7.51.0 release notes

sourceDesc.p: created retrospectively from ChangeLog and GitHub trackers

body.p: This release introduces new features and resolves a number of issues raised by the TEI community. As always, the majority of these changes and corrections are a consequence of feature requests or bugs reported by the TEI community using the GitHub tracking system. A full list of the issues resolved in the course of this release cycle may be found under the 4.2.0 milestone.

The following changes are particularly worth highlighting in this release:
The name element is now directly allowed in the place element (#1484).
The module descriptions have been improved (#1786).
A new element noteGrp for grouping notes has been introduced (#1833).
The object element is now allowed in the witness element (#1868).
A new xenoData example using GeoJSON has been added demonstrating the usage of non-XML data (#1884).
The material element is now a member of the attribute class att.typed. Furthermore, a free-standing function attribute has been added to the material element, including a sample values list (#1911).
The material element is now a member of the attribute class att.typed. Furthermore, a free-standing function attribute has been added to the material element, including a sample values list (#1911).
The class model.glossLike has been replaced with element references to equiv and gloss in the content models of category, joinGrp, and taxonomy to permit the usage of altIdent (#1919).
The free-standing precicate attribute on model has been replaced with a reference to the newly introduced attribute class att.predicate. The equiv element is now also a member of the new class (#1925).
The certainty element is now a member of the attribute class att.typed and an open value list for the type attribute has been created (#1934).
Elements from the RELAX NG annotations namespace are now allowed alongside elements from the RELAX NG schema language namespace inside content elements (#1937).
Unused test files have been removed from the Test directory (#1942).
The examples demonstrating the usage of the type attribute on listPerson elements has been improved (#1953).
The elements citeStructure and citeData have been introduced to allow documents to declare their citation structure and to specify how structural information may be exracted from them (#1953).
Two new elements and an attribute class have been introduced to allow documents to declare their citation structure and to specify how structural information may be extracted from them (#1953):
The attribute class att.citeStructurePart provides attributes for selecting particular elements within a document.
The citeData element specifies how information may be extracted from citation structures.
The citeStructure element declares a structure and method for citing the current document.
Licensing information has been added explicitly to the repository (#1962).
Chapter 5 on Characters, Glyphs, and Writing Modes points potential proposers of new characters to the Unicode Standards to the UC Berkeley Script Encoding Initiative for assistance (#1963).
The altIdentifier element is now a member of the attribute class att.datable (#1986).
Comments in ODD customization exemplars are now part of the documentation to avoid that comments lose their context after editing with Roma att.datable (#1987).
The elements author, editor, funder, meeting, principal, and sponsor are now members of the attribute class att.datable (#1992).
The new element persPronouns has been introduced to indicate the personal pronouns used, or assumed to be used, by the individual being described (#2010).
The free-standing type attribute has been added to interp, interpGrp, span, and spanGrp (#2012).
Several indefinite articles in front of element and attribute names have been corrected (#1951 and #2015).
The attribute class att.translatable has been moved from the TEI Infrastructure module to the Documentation Elements module (#2036 and #2097).
A Schematron rule has been added to enforce that if a specification element has any glosses, one of them must be in English. Accordingly, 198 specification files have been updated (#2037).
The introduction about place and location in Chapter 13 has been revisited (#2042).
The outdated directory 'genetic' has been removed (#2043).
The warning messages in the tei_customization have been improved (#2052).
New elements have been introduced for the encoding of ruby annotations, a particular method of glossing runs of text which is common in East Asian scripts (#2054, thanks to Kazuhiro Okada, Satoru Nakamura, Kiyonori Nagasaki, and Martin Holmes):
The ruby element contains a passage of base text along with its associated ruby gloss(es).
The rb element contains the base text annotated by a ruby gloss.
The rt element contains a ruby text, an annotation closely associated with a passage of the main text.
A subchapter on Ruby Annotations has been added, which is also referenced from several suitable places in the Guidelines. With this first take we hope to initiate further discussion and the implementation of additional use cases.
The description for the specDesc element has been improved and the key attribute is now required (#2061 and #2062).
The remarks of the match attribute in the attribute class att.scoping and the description of the class itself have been improved (#2078)
Several examples have been corrected and improved (#1932, #2087)
Furthermore, a number of translations have been added, updated or improved (#1989, #2082, #2101, #2074).

In addition, many improvements have been made to the XSLT stylesheets (which provide processing of TEI ODD files for Roma and OxGarage as well as other TEI conversions). The Stylesheets are maintained separately from the Guidelines at https://github.com/TEIC/Stylesheets. A full list of the issues resolved in the course of this release cycle may be found under the 7.51.0 milestone.

Highlights of this release include:
Test2 has been updated to use source/p5subset.xml (#456
A permalink has been added to all examples (#471
An erroneous resp attribute on the note element has been replaced with the type attribute in the OpenEdition output (#474
The hard-coded word "bibliography" in egXMLEndHook has been replaced with an i18n key (#478
An obsolete email address has been removed from the Guidelines pages (#484
